title: newContinuing, full-time, Plant Mechanic
description:
A willingness and ability to work any recognized shift, including weekends, is expected. From time to time, hours of work may be adjusted to suit operational needs.

The modified work schedule is available for this position.

UVic contributes to you and your family’s health and wellness through comprehensive medical, dental and pension benefits. We also offer:

  • generous vacation time;
  • generous leave compensation including maternity, parental, adoption, sick, and personal;
  • equity and diversity support and initiatives including religious observances
  • on-site childcare: infant – 5 years
  • discounted athletic facility memberships
  • sustainability initiatives, including discounted transit passes
  • support through our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
  • funding for career development and a diverse range of learning and development opportunities
  • tools and resources to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance
Job Summary

As stewards of the campus, Facilities Management fosters and enriches an inviting and functional environment that welcomes and supports all who come here. Facilities Management clients include faculty, staff and students. As part of Facilities Management the Mechanical Shop reflects high service delivery standards and requirements. The team works together to ensure effective, efficient and safe performance for the operation, maintenance and repair of building systems on campus.

Under general supervision, the Plant Mechanic will provide journeyperson or technician level skills in any one of the following trades: machinist; pipe/steam fitter; millwright (industrial mechanic); power engineer (min 3rd class); pipefitter/welder(pressure); or refrigeration/air conditioning or other similar trade or technical qualification suitable to UVic Facilities Management as defined by the Industrial Training Authority of BC (ITA), BC Safety Authority and/or recognized licensing or training institutions.The Plant Mechanic will fabricate, install, alter, repair and/or service any plant mechanical system or equipment designed for the purposes of heating and/or cooling (transfer of heat energy) or other mechanical or hydraulic energy. Includes work such as piping, gas-fitting, controls and electrical work related to this classification of equipment and where licensed and qualified by the relevant jurisdiction(s) as having authority to do this work.

Regulated work shall be performed only by incumbents holding required qualifications. The incumbent also performs related duties of similar scope and complexity in collaboration or independently within a multidisciplinary shop and full service facilities department which provides such services as plant and facilities engineering maintenance services. The incumbent will also assist in emergent situations, as reasonably declared by employer, within the physical and skill capacity of the individual.

Shall conform to all best practices in relation to UVic, regulated and industry standards of work and behaviors, including compliance to Worksafe BC regulations.

Job Requirements

Skills:

  • Ability to use initiative and varied trade skills in diagnosing and effecting repairs.
  • Ability to carry out an effective work schedule, under general supervision and utilize materials and equipment for maximum benefit.
  • Ability to plan and organize work efficiently.
  • Ability to maintain cooperative working relationships with faculty, staff and students.
  • Ability to operate and maintain control systems.
  • Literate in the use of personal computers and the MS office suite.
  • Ability to use resources and supplies in an efficient and cost effective manner.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and oral.
  • Ability to use hand and fixed power tools effectively (both fixed and portable) i.e. tools associated with mechanical trades including multi meters and other diagnostic equipment.
  • Competency in soldering, brazing, tack and cutting (with torch or electric).


As a staff member, this role should demonstrate UVic's Core Competencies which include Personal Effectiveness, Commitment to Quality, Navigating Change, Communication, Building Equitable Relationships, Teamwork, Service Focus, and University Community. These competencies represent the skills, knowledge and behaviours required to advance the initiatives of the unit/department and the university.



Specialized Knowledge/Education:

  • Completion of an approved apprenticeship or training program acceptable to employer.
  • Millwright (Industrial Mechanic); Pipe/steam Fitter; Power Engineering 3rd Class; Pipefitter/Welder (Pressure) or Refrigeration & A/C Mechanic TQ or related mechanical trade or occupation within HVAC industry.
  • Extensive institutional HVAC experince or equivalent.
  • Ammonia plant experience desirable.


For All Crafts:

  • BC or IP Red Seal Trade or Certificate of Qualification.
  • Valid British Columbia driver's license.
  • Good physical health, sufficient strength, stamina and coordination to perform a variety of routine heavy manual and machine operation tasks continuously.


Experience:

  • 5 years at the journeyperson/technician level in applicable trade preferably in an institutional environment.


Additional Requirements:

  • Willingness and ability to work any recognized shift including weekends.
  • May be required to assist with departmental response to emergent and safety related concerns.

Equity and Diversity Statement

UVic is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion in our living, learning and work environments. In pursuit of our values, we seek members who will work respectfully and constructively with differences and across levels of power. We actively encourage applications from members of groups experiencing barriers to equity.

Read our full equity statement here: www.uvic.ca/equitystatement.

Accessibility Statement

If you anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application and hiring process contact: uviccareers@uvic.ca Any personal information provided will be maintained in confidence.

COVID 19 On-Campus Requirements

The University of Victoria requires all students, staff and faculty coming to campus to declare their COVID-19 vaccination status. Your declaration is confidential and will be securely stored.

title: newCommissioning Engineer
description:
Commissioning Engineer

Contact us Apply for this job

Job information

Reference number

JR-0019101

Job function

Project & Product Management

Position type

Full time

Site

Richmond
150-2551 Viking Way, Richmond, BC V6V 1N4

GEA Heating & Refrigeration Technologies is a global specialist in industrial refrigeration, heating, and sustainable energy solutions for a wide array of industries including, food, beverage, dairy, and oil & gas. We offer interesting and challenging tasks, a positive working environment in international teams, and opportunities for personal development and growth in a global company.

Your responsibilities and tasks:

The Commissioning Engineer is responsible for starting up GEA’s freezer equipment line to meet design and contract requirements.This includes the planning and coordination of site visits with the Project Manager, Project Team Members, and the Customer. The Commissioning Engineer verifies the performance of the equipment on-site and delivers training to the owners’ operators. Strong communication and interpersonal skills will be critical to this individual’s success.


Roles and responsibilities:

  • Prepare equipment for operation according to design specifications and manufacturer instructions, which would include but are not limited to, lubrication, alignment, calibration, I/O checks, safety checks, and troubleshooting.

  • Optimize freezer controls and operation through testing, adjustments, dry and production runs

  • Conduct customer training with operations, cleaning, and maintenance personnel on-site. Provide classroom sessions as well as a demonstration of the machine and control panel.

  • Consult with Project Managers, Engineers, Installation Team, Vendors, or others to assemble commissioning plans and resolve issues.

  • Responsible for completion of commissioning records and consolidation of lessons learned.

  • Available occasionally for Commissioning calls after hours and on weekends

  • Provide support for development projects, service work, and product testing.

  • Responsible for up/downloads of software applications on Allen Bradley and Siemens PC + PLC hardware platforms

  • Contribute to team efforts by completing all tasks as may be assigned by the supervisor

  • Represent GEA before customers and external stakeholders with professionalism, clear communication, and thorough knowledge of the product

Your profile and qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or technical diploma in Industrial, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent

  • Minimum 3 years of commissioning experience is required

  • Ability to read and interpret technical specifications and drawings

  • Thorough knowledge of mechanical systems and rotating equipment

  • Ability to diagnose mechanical and electrical problems, implement corrections, and optimize operations

  • Food, Dairy, Brewery or Beverage industry process experience is an asset

  • Experience working with material handling and conveyor belts

  • Understanding of process technology, instrumentation, and controls

  • Working experience programming PLCs and HMIs would be a valuable asset

  • Must be willing and able to travel (approximately 50%-70% of the time)

  • Must be able to communicate effectively in English, both verbally and in writing

title: Mechanical Engineering
description:
As a part of our continued growth, our Burnaby office is seeking an energetic and ambitious Mechanical engineer-in-training to support the design and construction of buildings within the Transportation sector. You will work in a team environment with other engineers, technologists, BIM specialists, and project managers to deliver projects in this sector, as well as in support of those in other business lines (such as Buildings + Places and Water) to our clients both here in BC and across Western Canada. You will also be a part of multidisciplinary project teams comprising of other engineering disciplines, consultants, and architects.

The responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:

  • Assisting in preparation of deliverables and products such as presentation materials, calculations, drawings, specifications, selections, and cost estimates related to heating, ventilating, and air-conditioning (HVAC) and plumbing systems for commercial, institutional, and light industrial facilities.
  • Performing field investigation for incorporating existing conditions into construction documents.
  • Performing construction administration duties, such as shop drawing review, RFI response, construction inspection, and respond to client questions.
  • Working within a project team environment and possessing good presentation and client interface skills.
  • Coordinating work with other project disciplines.
  • Working with engineers in making technical mechanical decisions based on building code interpretation and company standard practice.
  • Staying abreast of industry standards and approaches, and best practices.
  • Ensuring project work is undertaken is accordance with corporate health and safety policies and quality management systems.
  • Performing assignments of limited scope and complexity. Uses a variety of standard engineering methods and techniques in solving problems.
  • Assisting engineers in carrying out technical tasks requiring accuracy in calculations, completeness of data and adherence to prescribed analysis, design, or computation methods.
  • Applying standard practices and techniques in specific situations. Gathers and correlates basic engineering data using established and well-defined procedures.
At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.

We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.

Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Registered (or be eligible for immediate registration) as an Engineer-in-Training in British Columbia.
  • 2+ years’ experience (ideally with an engineering firm) designing HVAC and plumbing for commercial, institutional, and light industrial facilities.
  • Physically able to climb ladders and enter utility manholes, tunnels, and other mechanical equipment spaces.
  • Valid BC Class V Driver's License.
Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience delivering industrial, transportation, and water/wastewater infrastructure projects.
  • Familiarity with ISO quality management systems.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications.
  • Experience working within internal multidisciplinary teams
  • Experience with Building Energy Modeling and their software platforms (IES, eQuest, Energy Plus, HOT2000, RETScreen, etc.) would be considered an asset
  • Experience with sustainability standards (LEED, Net Zero, Passive House, Envision) would be considered an asset
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Working experience with NBC, BCBC, BCPC, SMACNA, ASHRAE codes and standards.
  • Proficient with MS Office Suite.
  • Experience using HAP, AutoCAD, REVIT, Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, Project, and Power Point.
What We Offer

We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

title: Plastic engineer
description:
We are a start up manufacturing agency specializing in plastic manufacturing & custom product manufacturing.

We are looking for a mechanical engineer with extensive experience in plastic engineering.

You will be working with a project manager and a product designer in creating a line of products. The products you will be creating will be used with water, pump, heating device, and plastic components. Working with the team on the product concept and converting product drawings to 3D CAD models. It is a plus to have knowledge in Injection molding and consumer product creation.

You will be hired as a contractor and paid by the hour. Upon employment you will be required to sign a independent contractor agreement and a non-disclosure agreement before reviewing project documents.

Work schedule is flexible, you are able to meet in-person1-2 times a week or more if needed; join zoom calls, and reply to messages.

https://www.iptechinnovation.com/

Please send your resume and include your hourly rate.

Job Types: Part-time, Freelance

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Mechanical Engineers: 5 years (preferred)

title: newR&D engineer in digital simulation
description:
Job available at Soucy Caoutchouc – Drummondville

WHAT TO EXPECT

Under the supervision of the department head - simulation and modeling, your main mandate will be to develop tools to predict the performance and durability of our products. You will be part of a team recognized for its unique expertise and will benefit from an inter-branch influence.

Here's an overview of your tasks:

  • Develop and improve performance prediction tools (heating, abrasion wear, fatigue failure, etc.) for our products
  • In collaboration with our subsidiary Soucy Techno and the physical testing department, develop and improve the characterization tests of our rubbers in order to increase the accuracy of the results of numerical simulations
  • Validate our techniques by comparing numerical predictions with results obtained on vehicles
  • Advance our non-linear viscoelastic material models used to model our rubbers
  • Actively participate in the technological advancement of products in all sectors by performing work aimed at a better understanding of damage mechanisms and performance
  • Support the optimization of our products using numerical models and specific calculations
  • Support the engineering of all sectors by developing advanced design tools
  • Ensure scientific watch in relevant fields
  • Act as a technical reference for the engineering and development of current and future products

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

  • Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or other related field
  • Graduate training in a relevant field of expertise
  • At least 5 years of experience (including PhD if applicable) in numerical simulations
  • Strong interest in research and development
  • Advanced programming skills (Python and Matlab) (asset)
  • Technical knowledge of the thermomechanical behavior of elastomers (asset)
  • Practical experience with explicit dynamic finite element modeling software such as Abaqus/Explicit (asset)
  • Practical experience in a manufacturing company (asset)
  • Interest in recreational, industrial, military or agricultural vehicles (asset)

WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

  • Permanent full-time position
  • You'll be joining a team that's committed to solving day-to-day issues, but always in a pleasant work environment!
  • The best of both worlds: the resources of a large company and a family-like atmosphere
  • A team that is passionate, attentive and committed to excellence
  • A dynamic and stimulating work environment
  • Flexible schedules that allow you to balance your work and your personal life
  • Group insurance (different plans adapted to your needs)
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan with employer contributions
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Social activities.

APPLY NOW!

We look forward to getting to know you and to welcoming you to our big Soucy family!

title: Operating Engineer 2nd Class
description:
Description

Operating Engineer 2nd Class $50.42 - $53.72/hr

''Innovation is facilitated by having the right people in the right roles with the right skills and values.''
- Charles Koch, Koch Industries Chairman and CEO

Flexible Benefits Package and Competitive Pension Plan

INVISTA has invested significantly in the Kingston Manufacturing Site recently completing projects in power cogeneration, energy efficiency, and automation. Come join the Power Services Operation as a 2nd Class Operating Engineer as we continue to transform.

The Power Services Operation manages the provision of services for building and process heating, compressed air, water and electrical power to the Kingston Manufacturing Site. Equipment and facilities are located across the site and include pumps, compressors, chillers, treatment facilities, boilers and a cogeneration unit.

Want to learn more about the INVISTA experience? Watch this!

Job Responsibilities:

  • Operate, maintain and improve equipment to supply uninterrupted services such as compressed air, water, water inlet and discharge treatment, chilled water, steam, inert gas, hot oil system (DP:DPO) and electricity to the Kingston site.
  • Work in conjunction with other engineers and plant operations to monitor and control key services variables including rates, pressures and temperatures. Individual and team troubleshooting and problem solving are an integral part of this assignment.
  • Responsibilities include adherence to area standard practices and operating procedures, procurement, measurement and transfer of chemicals, documentation and record keeping.
  • Work in a respectful manner in a team environment

Qualifications & Requirements:

  • Currently possess a 2nd Class Operating Engineer Certificate
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in a manufacturing, chemical, petrochemical or refinery plant environment
  • Demonstrated ability to use necessary computer and process control tools in a control room environment
  • Ability to work a twelve-hour rotating shift, modified twelve-hour shift, or eight-hour days, on a rotational basis, and as required for training and development purposes
  • Ability to work in an industrial environment with varying temperatures and conditions

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Past work experience demonstrating strong personal commitment to work safely with an ability to adhere to standard practices and procedures
  • Demonstrated work performance that is consistent with a team environment
  • Demonstrated self-motivation to identify resources to resolve problems
  • Established experience in utilizing discretionary time to complete value adding work
  • Demonstrated interest in mechanical equipment, control systems and major energy transformations
  • Related maintenance experience and/or certification in one or more of the following trades: instrumentation technician, electrician, gas fitter, pipe fitter or industrial mechanic

Physical Requirements and Working Conditions

  • There is a requirement to work from heights, work in confined spaces, work in areas of elevated temperatures or outside in inclement weather, and wear breathing apparatus and respirators.

Why Work for INVISTA?

  • A culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance
  • Opportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the world
  • Encouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledge
  • Ability to contribute to a shared vision of innovation while conserving resources

We Provide:

  • $50.42 /hr plus shift premiums paid during evenings, nights and Sundays, in addition to hourly rates above (an additional $3.30 per hour for Shift Engineers)
  • Flexible benefits package
  • Competitive pension plan
  • Performance bonus program with possibility to earn and additional 2,4,8 or 12% on every hour worked
  • Additional vacation purchase program
  • Additional floating holidays
  • Education Assistance Program for enhanced job-related training

How to apply:

Picture yourself at INVISTA and submit a detailed resume in English along with a covering letter to www.kochcareers.com

Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants in advance, but please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage

title: Engineer, Process
description:
ABOUT US

Trans-Northern Pipelines Inc. (TNPI) operates regulated pipelines to safely transport the refined petroleum products (gasoline, diesel, aviation, and heating fuel) used by Canadian businesses and consumers every day. These pipelines connect refineries in Edmonton to Calgary, including the Calgary International Airport; and refineries in Nanticoke, Ont., and Montreal to the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), with lateral pipelines to Ottawa as well as to Pearson International Airport and Pierre-Elliot Trudeau International Airport. In operation since the 1950s, we are committed to operating in a safe and environmentally responsible manner to protect the public, the environment, and the pipelines.


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

TNPI offers a stable, flexible work environment with predictable business growth. The company is backed by three major shareholders who are all Fortune 500 companies and among the oil and gas industry leaders in North America.

TNPI has a culture that supports personal initiative, and is a place where employees have considerable autonomy and ownership of their functions. The flat organizational structure allows for broad mandates and the opportunity to expand your skills and experience, as well as access to decision-makers and senior leadership. The TNPI culture is collegial, values employee input, and supports work/life balance. TNPI achieves operational excellence in four pillars: Safety, Environment, Reliability and People.


POSITION SUMMARY

Reporting to the Manager, Process Engineering, the Engineer, Process is responsible for base business and project support related to both pipeline and facility support. This position provides support by developing and maintaining engineering standards, specifications, procedures and related records, promoting continual improvement through participation with industry groups and lessons learned.

The Engineer, Process delivers completed scope on time, on budget, within a prescribed scope, and to a high quality of work. The engineer may be a technical subject matter expert and is responsible for a wide variety of technical support functions within the TNPI, including pipeline operations, pipeline equipment and process control.

OEMS

This job is accountable for ensuring that all aspects of work comply with safe work practices, all applicable codes, standards, regulatory requirements and TNPI’s Operational Excellence Management System (OEMS).

Security, Environment and Health & Safety

This job performs their job effectively safely, securely, and in a manner protective of the environment, and complies with TNPI Safety and Environmental Absolutes.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Base Business Support

  • Applies process and project engineering principles to resolve pipeline operation problems and improve performance with focus on safe and reliable operations
  • Resolves emergencies in a timely manner with critical thinking and decision making
  • Budgets, forecasts, designs, coordinates, schedules, tracks and completes assigned scope and projects for new or modified pipeline facilities and pipeline maintenance; as dictated by the need to satisfy throughput requirements, deal with customer concerns and maintain the integrity of the pipeline system
  • Assists operational disciplines such as field services and product movement in annual reviews, changes requiring engineering involvement and operation and maintenance troubleshooting utilizing management of change processes and procedures
  • May act as field focal. Field focal is intended to be the first point of contact for field and operational personnel where engineering support is required in response to incidents, maintenance, information requests, development of improvement opportunities, work execution strategies and planning, or any situation requiring assistance and technical capability
  • Predicts the requirement for projects, budget and forecast for future necessity
  • Prepares/revises engineering specifications and standards as required ensuring compliance with applicable codes, regulations and industry best practices
  • Supports continuous improvement in OEMS areas and improvement of corresponding Key Performance Indicators
  • Determines the need for outside resources to support study and project activity and to engage same if deemed necessary
  • Creates and monitors projects within the company enterprise resource (ER) management solution, maintains project documentations, updates manuals and drawings, and coordinates management of change as required by the scope of the project
  • Ensures that multiple stakeholders on a scope of work/project are informed of the proposed activities and all necessary approvals and/or permits are obtained prior to proceeding with the work
  • Maintains process engineering related documents. Ensures all affected process engineering drawings or documents are updated with as-built or revisions.
  • Performs incident investigations and stewards corrective actions as assigned
  • Supports capital projects by providing feedback from process engineering and operational perspective ensuring compliance with applicable codes, regulations, company policies and standards as well as industry best practices

Risk Assessments and Management

  • Performs risk assessments for all proposed temporary and/or permanent changes to or deviances from normal operating procedures and practices related to base business support
  • Compile, analyze, assess and present solutions as part of a risk assessment
  • Preparation of studies to determine the optimum solution for resolving pipeline concerns. Principally this involves cost estimating, hydraulic optimization, operation controls, drawing preparation, ensuring compliance with all applicable regulations, codes and standards
  • Identify and assess risks based on all inputs such as HIDs, Incidents, Near Misses, operational concerns or observed issues as pro-active as practical.
  • Prioritize changes/issues based on risks

Strategic Department Planning

Assist in the preparation of company annual capital and expense budgets and long-range plans

Stakeholder reports and notifications

  • Provides assistance in preparation and/or presentation of regulatory correspondences to the CER (Canada Energy Regulator) or AER (Alberta Energy Regulator)

Preparation of compliance reports for regulatory bodies, principally the CER, AER, TSB, MOE and MEQ

Employee Development and Coaching

  • Provides training to others as deemed necessary to meet company needs and support a working environment that strives to meet and exceed company objectives whilst continually improving
  • Maintains familiarity with technological developments and determine applicability to the pipeline system
  • Provides mentorship to junior engineers and EITs


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Bachelor of Engineering (B.Eng.) or Applied Science. Preferred Master of Engineering (M.Eng.) or Master of Science (M.Sc or M.A.Sc) in Mechanical, and Chemical.

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Class “G” Driver’s license, along with a reliable personal vehicle with insurance per Company Policy

TECHNICAL SKILLS

Minimum MS Office, Hydraulic behavior understanding, ICS (Industrial Control System) knowledge, Operations support exposure, CSA Z662 knowledge, Risk assessment techniques, and Operation and Maintenance.

Preferred AutoCAD, Project Management Experience, Technical knowledge around pipeline codes and regulations such as CSA, ASME, NFPA, CER onshore regulation, AER, Hydraulic analysis software (AFT, SPS) experience, Technical knowledge around pipeline equipment design such as pumps, control valves and metering manifolds, SCAT and 5-why method experience, and Pipeline operations and maintenance.

TRANSFERABLE SKILLS

  • Understanding and demonstration of Journey to Zero principles and Standards
  • Broad based analytical, problem solving and trouble-shooting capability and decision making
  • Fluency in English language
  • Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal/team skills
  • Must be a team player with a track record of effective implementation within a multi-discipline team environment
  • Effective Non-Authoritative Leadership (NAL) skills
  • Self-starter –able to initiate, recommend and gain support for implementation of solutions and improvements
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively network to seek out and implement best practices and technology
  • Ability to coordinate & work with a sustained effort to meet deadlines and understand impact if not attained
  • Ability to manage time & resources to address numerous issues & work processes simultaneously
  • Ability to anticipate potential problems & opportunities
  • Ability to identify and implement “fit for purpose” solutions in a small company
  • Preferred ability to get the point across in a multi-disciplinary environment and ability to interpret complicated issues and simplifying them for the purpose of resolution

YEARS OF POSITION RELATED EXPERIENCE

  • Minimum 2-5 years of work related experience. Preferred 5-10 years.

MORE OF WHAT WE OFFER

  • Work in a small, highly competent team whose members share your high sense of commitment.
  • Industry-competitive compensation.


We are an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest. Only applicants selected for an interview will you be contacted.

Department: Engineering & Integrity.

Location: GTA, Richmond Hill, ON (Head Office) or Montreal.

Apply if you are local or interested to relocate to these areas.

Job Types: Full- Time, Permanent

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
General Summary:

We are looking for an experienced Electrical Engineer to continue the development of a heating control system for our diesel fired heaters for use in recreational vehicles and boats. The control system uses CAN communication, can connect to the Android or iPhone App through a WiFi module. The control system can also be programmed remotely through WiFi. The control system is currently being beta tested and needs to be brought to market after going through EMC testing and certification. Besides the continued development of the new control system and implementation of innovative features to advance our products, we need an Electrical engineer to support our existing products.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Design electronic microcontroller circuits.
  • Embedded C programming and firmware development.
  • Develop schematic circuit diagrams and design PCB layouts.
  • Test and troubleshoot embedded microcontroller and general electronic circuit boards.
  • Create electronics design related documents and resources.
  • Read electronic devices’ datasheets and manuals and verify their compatibility to the design.
  • Development of Android and iPhone Apps
  • Support existing control systems by finding alternate components for obsolete parts.

Job Specifications:

  • 5 - 10 years of experience in firmware design using C
  • 5 – 10 years of experience with Orcad for schematic and PCB layouts
  • 2 – 5 years of experience developing Apps for Android and iPhone
  • Experience with Microchip and Atmel microcontrollers
  • Experience implementing CAN communication protocol
  • Fluent in English language (written and verbal)
  • Ability to work under pressure in a dynamic environment.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $65,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Circuit design: 5 years (preferred)
  • Firmware: 5 years (preferred)
  • Android and iPhone App design: 2 years (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: newIntermediate QA Engineer
description:
Country:

Canada

Location:

LOC13089: 408-90 Sumach Street, Toronto, ON M5A 4R4

ABOUT US:

In 1902, Willis Carrier solved one of mankind’s most elusive challenges by controlling the indoor environment through modern air conditioning. His invention enabled countless industries, promoting global productivity, health, and personal comfort.

Today, Carrier innovations are found across the globe and in virtually every facet of daily life. We create comfortable and productive environments, regardless of the climate. We safeguard the global food supply by preserving the quality and freshness of food and beverages. We ensure health and well-being by enabling the proper transport and delivery of vital medical supplies under exacting conditions. We provide solutions, services, and education to lead the green building movement. These mark just a handful of the ways that Carrier works to make the world a better place to live, work and play.

Each day, the team at Carrier is working to meet some of the most unique and exciting global challenges in heating and air conditioning. To maintain our role as global leaders, we are always looking for talented, ambitious individuals to join us. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for an opportunity to develop your career, then we have a great opportunity for you.

BrokerBay is a new division of the Fire and Security business within Carrier. BrokerBay is shaping the future of how brokerages, agents, and consumers transact in real estate. BrokerBay is an advanced cloud-based ecosystem designed to replace the clunky legacy systems previously used by brokerages across North America. We’re on a mission to consolidate, automate, and revolutionize the way brokerages do business from start to finish with. As one of the fastest-growing real estate startups in Canada, there’s no better place to be if you’re looking for a dynamic work environment with plenty of room to grow professionally.

What You Will Be Doing:

  • Work as a single tester in a scrum team.

  • Be responsible for all test strategies coming from the team.

  • Create and maintain documentation related to any new feature your team works with.

  • Decide what should be automated and how.

  • Help maintain our automated test suite with any changes that may come from your team.

  • Collaborate with the team to understand product changes to deal with issues/defects in a timely manner.

  • Contribute to our testing feedback process with other team members and developers.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • 3+ years overall in software testing, and ideally some exposure to software test automation.

  • Familiarity and comfort with Javascript, Cypress, Appium, and webdriver.io.

  • Ideally have exposure to Docker, AWS, CI/CD, and instrumentation tooling.

  • Well versed in API automation tests

Preferably:

  • You're organized and detail-oriented.

  • You're naturally curious and driven to solve problems.

  • You have a strong interest in and a knack for technology.

  • You love using websites and apps, and you get excited when you find an error to be resolved.

  • You're passionate about providing a great product.

  • You're a team player and can work independently to achieve team goals.

  • You love to learn and are not afraid to research the answers you need.

Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age, or any other federally protected class.

title: Mechanical Engineer in Training
description:
Location: Moncton, NB
Job Description:
Since 1964 the MCW Group has built a solid reputation for the delivery of Professional Consulting Engineering Services, Energy Management Services, and Engineering Development Services.

The systems designed by the MCW Group of Companies are built to deliver energy effectively in the form of lighting, heating and cooling, as well as information in the form of voice and data. By the very nature of the solutions provided, the MCW Group of Companies help to create the environments required for Clients to live, educate, work, play and heal.

We have created for our clients the largest block of verified carbon emissions savings of any Canadian consulting firm. For more than two decades MCW Consultants Ltd., and its sister company, MCW Custom Energy Solutions Ltd. have been providing sustainable building designs with the goal to permanently reduce our clients' environmental footprint and create sustainable communities.

For further Information please check out our website: www.mcw.com.

Our Company is currently seeking a self-motivated, hardworking Mechanical Engineering graduate to join our Moncton Office. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is looking to gain valuable hands-on experience in a dynamic, team-based working environment.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for the development and management of assigned project work during all phases, from inception through planning, design and construction, in accordance with the project scope, schedule and budget

Major Functions:

· Prepare the concept design and complete load calculations, schematics, equipment selection and system concept report.

· Coordinate with other disciplines internally as well as externally with consultants and architects

· Prepare the contract documents including the specifications.

· Conduct site visits during the construction phase.

· Work with the field review team during the construction phase and ensure code compliance.

· Update the schedule regularly as agreed to for the project

· Evaluate shop drawing reviews.

· Provide the Project Manager with various status reports

· Escalate resource issues to the appropriate Project Manager

· Assist in sourcing new work and maintaining existing client base

· Overtime as required

Qualifications, Experience and Education:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or other relevant discipline such as Building Systems
  • Eligibility for professional licensing in the Province of New Brunswick
  • Ability to participate in a multi-disciplined team to achieve project success
  • Able to communicate ideas and recommendations to non-engineer team members in a clear manner
  • Knowledge of Canadian/American Engineering standards
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing with all levels of the organization, including executives
  • Excellent time management and project management skills
  • High level of sound and independent judgment and reasoning
  • Ability to interpret and implement company policies and procedures

Required Skills:

  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD and REVIT is an asset
  • Require comprehensive knowledge of current engineering principles and practices,

complemented with a strong knowledge of project management concepts and practices

  • Experience conducting site visits would be an asset.
  • Able to communicate ideas and recommendations to non-engineer team members in a

clear manner

  • Knowledge of Canadian/American Engineering standards
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing with all levels of the

organization, including executives

  • Excellent time management and project management skills
  • High level of sound and independent judgment and reasoning
  • Ability to interpret and implement company policies and procedures

MCW offers competitive salaries, health, dental, life benefit plans and other benefits. We appreciate the opportunity to review your resume and your interest in MCW.

Interested applicants please send your application to:

http://www.mcw.com/Careers/Details/Mechanical-Engineer-EIT@Moncton

include the position title in the subject line.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

MCW Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Operating Engineer, Class 3 - (7 Positions)
description:
Under the supervision of the Chief Operating Engineer or his/her designate, to perform the duties required of an Operating Engineer CL 3.

Functions and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

The Operating Engineer CL 3 is directly accountable for:

  • Operating CRL Powerhouse equipment
  • Operating heating, ventilation and air conditioning equipment, including ventilating fans, refrigeration compressors, pumps, steam and hot water boilers, both oil and gas, hot water heating systems, chilled water and DX (Direct Expansion) air conditioning systems
  • Ensuring that the equipment is operated in a safe and efficient manner according to written procedures or verbal instruction and to institute corrective action when necessary
  • Testing operating and safety controls, such as pressure switches, pressure relief valves, thermostats, control valves, traps, etc., to ensure that they are performing properly
    Adjusting instrument control point settings to maintain proper temperature and humidity.
  • Operating and maintaining a DDC (Distributed Digital Control) system including but not limited to monitoring, adjusting, programming and minor maintenance
  • Recording and maintaining records on energy use: steam, air, water and electricity.
  • Recording temperature, relative humidity, and other operating conditions, as instructed
  • Performing routine patrols of site buildings to check for abnormal conditions in HVAC, sanitary sewer, firewater, service water systems, etc.
  • Performing routine checks of sewage treatment plant
  • Maintaining good housekeeping practices in all work areas, adhering to provincial, federal and CNL regulations in order to provide a safe and efficient working environment
  • Attending monthly safety meetings and immediately report any safety concerns and/or infractions. Apply CNL’s Event Free Tools procedure throughout the execution of assigned work and model this behaviour and knowledge to others
    Assisting in the training, coaching and mentoring of new employees in safe practices and procedures.
  • Performing water tests to determine water treatment measures needed, maintaining water quality in boilers, open and closed loop heating and cooling systems
    Maintaining written and electronic log books

Education

  • Grade 12 Secondary School Graduation Diploma
  • Qualification as a 3rd Class Operating Engineer in the Province of Ontario (Standardized)
  • Valid Class G Ontario Driver’s license.

Abilities and Skills

  • Knowledge of all applicable codes and standards including the Technical Standards and Safety Act – Ontario Regulation #219/01 – Operating Engineers, and all applicable CNL procedures in order to provide a safe and healthy work environment
  • Demonstrate use and endorsement of Personal Protection Equipment (PPE)
  • Knowledge of high pressure steam boilers and related control systems
  • Written and verbal communication skills to be able to work in multi-trade groups and communicate with CNL staff across a broad range of disciplines
  • Good computer skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office in order to update and write procedures, create spreadsheets, input data and communicate via email.

title: Operations and Maintenance Stationary Engineer (Union)
description:
Job Details

What you will do:

The O&M Stationary Engineer is responsible for the maintenance and repair of Hospital infrastructure equipment and systems in both the Central Utility Plant and Hospital mechanical rooms.

Reporting Relationship

The O&M Stationary Engineer reports directly to the Chief Operating Engineer.

How you will do it:

  • Operate and maintain all mechanic equipment such as steam boilers, compressors, generators, air conditioning, H.V.A.C units and other related building equipment and systems.
  • Inspect, install, repair, and replace pipes, fittings, and maintain heating, water and drainage systems
  • Record readings from equipment in the logbook
  • Perform chemical tests on boilers, air conditioning, heating, water softeners, and applies chemicals as needed
  • Clean and change filters as required
  • Perform routine repair duties in the kitchen, M.D.R., and Operating Room
  • Perform routine duties in the mechanical rooms
  • Perform Daily or Nightly rounds of equipment and systems and record readings on the Rounds Cards
  • Clean, lubricate, and check belts, steam traps, and pumps
  • Perform all maintenance duties throughout the Hospital after hours and on weekends when the Facility Maintenance Department is closed
  • Participate in all departmental training programs including but not limited to, Lock Out/Tag Out, but all other JCCLP Safety Toolbox talks.
  • May shovel snow, and spread salt and sand to assist snow removal contractor
  • Ensure personal protective equipment is properly utilized and maintained
  • Actively participate in all Hospital Codes (either tests or real) directly related to Facility Maintenance involvement

What we look for:

  • Knowledge and understanding of the Occupational Health and Safety Act (attend training as required)
  • 4th Class Stationary Engineer or above
  • Refrigeration Ticket B
  • Graduate of a trade or vocational school
  • Graduate of a Building Operators Technicians course is preferred
  • Previous experience in a large institution working with HVAC, Med Gas, Life Safety systems, and other infrastructure equipment
  • Ability to perform a variety of duties according to specific assignments
  • Excellent communication skills when dealing with staff and patients
  • Ability to read, write, and follow oral and written instruction

Physical Demands

  • Lifting and carrying objects weighing up to 50 lbs.
  • Climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch to make repairs or installations, or to gain access to pipes.
  • Near-visual acuity.
  • Subject to noise and heat from machinery.

Johnson Controls and each of its Canadian subsidiaries are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants, candidates and employees with disabilities, in accordance with applicable human rights legislation and in Ontario, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (“AODA”). If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit www.johnsoncontrols.com/careers

Canada Diversity Statement

Information obtained from the questions below will allow Johnson Controls to track the diversity of our applicants, employee training opportunities, promotions and employee retention in order to identify and remove barriers to employment and advancement. With your consent, you may also be contacted by the employment equity officer to get your opinions about Employment Equity (EE) Programs.

You have the right to review, correct, or change information relating to you at any time and you can be assured that the information will not be used for unauthorized purposes.

Please note that a person may belong to more than one designated group.

Your response to the self-identification questionnaire below is voluntary. It is however mandatory to answer the questions, even if you choose not to provide the information.

The responses that you provide on this form will be confidentially retained for statistical purposes.

This survey is available in alternative formats. Please do not hesitate to request.

Persons with disabilities are those that have a long-term or recurring physical, mental, sensory, psychiatric or learning impairment and who consider themselves to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment, or believe that an employer or potential employer is likely to consider them to be disadvantaged in employment by reason of that impairment. This also includes persons whose functional limitations owing to their impairment have been accommodated in their current job or workplace.

An Aboriginal person is a North American Indian, Métis, or Inuit and/or a Treaty Indian or a Registered Indian and/or member of an Indian Band/First Nation.

Members of visible minorities are persons, other than Aboriginal peoples, who are non-Caucasian in race or non-white in colour, regardless of birthplace.

title: CAD Operator
description:
Position: CAD Operator

Location: Truro, NS
Job Description:
Since 1964 the MCW Group has built a solid reputation for the delivery of Professional Consulting Engineering Services, Energy Management Services, and Engineering Development Services.

The systems designed by the MCW Group of Companies are built to deliver energy effectively in the form of lighting, heating and cooling, as well as information in the form of voice and data. By the very nature of the solutions provided, the MCW Group of Companies help to create the environments required for Clients to live, educate, work, play and heal.

We have created for our clients the largest block of verified carbon emissions savings of any Canadian consulting firm. For more than two decades MCW Consultants Ltd., and its sister company, MCW Custom Energy Solutions Ltd. have been providing sustainable building designs with the goal to permanently reduce our clients' environmental footprint and create sustainable communities.

Our Company is currently seeking a self-motivated, hardworking CAD Operator to join our Truro Office. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is looking to grow and develop their professional career.

Compensation: To be commensurate with experience.

Responsibilities: The Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to the following:

  • Prepare and/or aid in the preparation of construction drawings as required by Project Engineer(s), Designer(s), & Senior Technologists.
  • Check and verify design drawings to conform to corporate CAD standards and good drafting practices. Ensure the documents is clear and ‘buildable’.
  • Utilize modern computer-assisted design (CAD) and modeling software for maximum quality and efficiency of producing construction documents. This includes all stages including concept through tender, addendum sketches, and as-built records.
  • Process/prepare received documents for internal use (i.e. Clean-up of Architectural floor plans, sections in accordance with established procedures).
  • Utilize Bluebeam (PDF) to produce working and final documents.
  • Utilize other software such as MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Consistently follow company policies, procedures and file structures/format.
  • Perform general duties as required such as printing/plotting/scanning/conversion/quantity take-offs/measurement.
  • All duties to be performed accurately and efficiently in order to deliver quality product/service on schedule.

Qualifications, Experience and Education:

  • The position requires the incumbent to have proficiency with AutoCAD
  • Experience with Revit (BIM) is an asset.
  • Mechanical and Electrical knowledge would be an asset
  • Ability to meet deadlines/successful completion of deliverables
  • Ability to communicate and work well with other departments
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to work under pressure on either single or multiple tasks
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Team and client-focused

Required Skills:

  • Achievement Orientation - Focusing efforts on achieving high quality results to help others meet and exceed the organization’s standards.
  • Attention to Detail - Working in a conscientious, consistent and thorough manner in order to recognize less obvious information.
  • Using Information Technology - Using software and information technology to demonstrate basic knowledge and ability, and with guidance, can apply the competency in common situations that present limited difficulties to accomplish one's work.
  • Resilience - Remains energized and focused in the face of occasional ambiguity, change or strenuous work demands.
  • Planning and Organizing- Developing, implementing, evaluating and adjusting own plans and activities to reach goals, while ensuring the optimal use of resources.
  • Initiative - Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently by identifying the immediate action needed and seizing the opportunities that arise.

· Information Management - Demonstrates basic knowledge and ability and, with guidance uses appropriate procedures to collect, organize, retrieve, maintain and disseminate information in common situations that present limited difficulties.

· Client Focus – Provides added value through service excellence to internal and/or external clients.

· Resilience – Remains energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands.

MCW offers competitive salaries, health, dental, life benefits plans and other benefits. We appreciate the opportunity to review your resume and your interest in MCW.

Interested applicants please email your resume to: rpenner@ mcw.com. Include the position title in the subject line.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

MCW Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: newMechanical Technician
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Since 1964 the MCW Group has built a solid reputation for the delivery of Professional Consulting Engineering Services, Energy Management Services, and Engineering Development Services.

The systems designed by the MCW Group of Companies are built to deliver energy effectively in the form of lighting, heating and cooling, as well as information in the form of voice and data. By the very nature of the solutions provided, the MCW Group of Companies help to create the environments required for clients to live, educate, work, play and heal.

We have created for our clients the largest block of verified carbon emissions savings of any Canadian consulting firm. For more than two decades MCW Consultants Ltd., and its sister company, MCW Custom Energy Solutions Ltd. have been providing sustainable building designs with the goal to permanently reduce our clients' environmental footprint and create sustainable communities.

For further Information please check out our website: www.mcw.com.

Our Company is currently seeking a self-motivated, hardworking Mechanical Engineering Technician to join our Toronto office. This is an excellent opportunity for a new graduate who is looking to gain valuable hands-on work experience in a dynamic, team-based working environment, as well as grow and develop their professional career in the consulting industry.

Position: Mechanical Engineering Technician

Location: Toronto, Ontario

Primary Objective: Responsible for the preparation of engineering design and drawings using AutoCAD and REVIT MEP while ensuring that design drawings conform to specifications and design data.

Responsibilities: The Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to the following:

  • Assist with the preparation of drawings, BIM models and schematics
  • Coordinate with other consulting disciplines to ensure drawing integrity and completeness
  • Work with project team and Project Manager to ensure on-time project completion
  • Attend meetings and conduct site inspections in combination with the Project Engineer or Design Technologist
  • Strive to ensure quality and timely delivery of finished products to clients
  • Perform general duties as required such as printing/plotting, submitting drawings to contractor and completing mark-ups for ‘as builts’ and in turn updating MCW records
  • Overtime as required

Qualifications, Experience and Education:

  • Completion of post-secondary education in Mechanical Engineering Technology, or a related discipline.
  • Registered with OACETT and working towards obtaining Certified Engineering Technician or Technologist an asset.
  • Experience in the construction industry is an asset
  • Familiarity with Revit MEP is an asset
  • Experience with Microsoft Office tools including Excel, Word, Project and PowerPoint
  • Experience working with customers and client base
  • Experience working in a team based environment

Required Skills:

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Proven ability to meet deadlines/successful completion of deliverables.
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.
  • Excellent time management skills.
  • Ability to work under pressure.
  • Analytical, thorough, resourceful and detail-oriented.
  • Team and customer service-focused.
  • Self-motivated, hardworking, flexible.

Job Specific Competencies:

Analytical Thinking – Analyzing and synthesizing information to understand issues

Client Focus – Providing service excellence with added value to internal and/or external clients

Continuous Learning – Identifying and addressing learning and developmental needs to enhance own performance

Creativity and Innovation – Modifies current approaches to generating viable, new approaches and solutions

Initiative – Addresses current issues by dealing with situations proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise

Interactive Communication – Listening to others and communicating articulately, fostering two-way open communication

Legislative, Policies, Procedures & Standards – Understanding and using relevant legislation, policies, procedures and/or standards in performing one’s work

Results Management – Supervises work/projects by organizing time, work and resources to accomplish in the most effective and efficient way

Self Confidence – Demonstrating realistic trust in own abilities and confidence when challenged

Teamwork – Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals

Interested applicants please apply online or send your application to careers@mcw.com including the position title in the subject line.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those being considered for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

MCW Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer.

MCW Consultants Ltd. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: newCorporate Project Engineer II - Packaging Equipment
description:
Redpath Sugar is located on Toronto’s historic downtown waterfront and has been a part of Canada’s heritage for more than 160 years. Our brand is the oldest food-related trademark in Canada and is recognized across the country. Redpath Sugar is part of ASR Group, the largest cane sugar refiner in the world.


OVERVIEW

Corporate Project Engineer II - Packaging Equipment is required to manage all major aspects of design and construction associated with assigned improvement projects. Responsibilities span all phases of the project execution cycle including gathering requirements, preliminary design, cost estimation, project evaluation and justification, equipment procurement, layout, design, construction management and commissioning. Most projects involve a high level of coordination with existing plant operations and lend themselves to a hands-on style, with the candidate working in the field a significant amount of time to assist in project execution. This role is an individual contributor with demonstrated ability to lead, supervise and make decisions.


ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop effective SOW’s for project work / equipment installation.
  • Work closely with Procurement and Operations teams to establish project deliverables with regular communication regarding progress.
  • Develop designs for field-detailed items and implement design changes as required.
  • Supervise contractors from bid walks to proposals, fabrication, installation and commissioning, communicate and resolving problems in a timely manner
  • Manage project costs and schedule
  • Plan and lead commissioning efforts including supporting resources.
  • Support and facilitate development of long term capex projects with operational teams.
  • Support and expand the use of company standard project implementation tools and reporting systems.


WORK EXPERIENCE

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Packaging Engineer or in an engineering related position with hands-on experience in completion of packaging projects and working with packaging line design and install.
  • Industrial Food Production, Food & Beverage or Consumers Packaged Goods experience.
  • Power and control systems as it pertains to process system equipment and project scope development desired.
  • PMP certification desired



EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor of Science in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical or Chemical preferred)


ESSENTIAL CAPABILITIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES)

  • Solid verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience with GMP/ Sanitary Design /HAACP Practices preferred
  • Skilled in Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and MS projects
  • Proficient with using an electronic CAD drawing system (AutoCad preferred).
  • Must be able to prepare and read PFDs and P&IDs
  • Experience with packaging systems equipment for example:
  • Product feed systems and material handling, Blenders/mixer, volumetric/gravimetric systems, sifters, heat exchangers and supporting heating/cooling systems.
  • Instrumentation: PLCs, valves and instrumentation
  • Fillers, package conveying and collation, case erectors/packers, palletizers, metal detectors etc.


LOCATION OF ROLE

  • On site in Toronto with occasional projects assignments at Belleville plant.
  • Some occasional travel - domestically and some locations within the USA


For more than 100 years, our employees have taken pride in “Making Life a Little Sweeter” by providing our customers and consumers with quality service and sugar products. Our commitment to that principle drives us in all that we do and encourages us to uphold our company’s high ethical standards of business conduct to ensure our continued success

title: Design Engineer - Mechanical
description:
As the leading integrated energy services company, Shawcor is responsible for protecting the integrity of operational assets around the world.


Our continued success in our current markets and the unrelenting pursuit of our "growth vision" is possible by our valuable employees who embodies intellect, dedication and the highest form of professionalism.


At Shawcor, we continually seek individuals who share our values which includes; integrity, execution, and technology coupled with accountability, respect and always doing the right thing.

Our foundation is integrity, which is not only how we operate-it is the cornerstone of every product we engineer and project we undertake. It is the assurance we provide to each of our customers.


At Shawcor, we have created a true team environment where all employees are encouraged and empowered to contribute to the overall success of the company. A true team environment that fosters an environment of safety, leadership, the opportunity for growth, and a bright future!


We are interested in YOU!


The Mechanical Design Engineer is Responsible for:

  • Responsible for the design and specification of mechanical equipment and process systems to ensure operation in a safe, efficient and cost effective manner. Assist with project management, procurement and construction activities associated with new or upgraded manufacturing facilities.
  • Mechanical design of new coating facilities, process systems, and components to improve safety and productivity. Specification of mechanical and process equipment to meet customer requirements.
  • Generate design/schematic drawings and process description documents for complex systems and equipment.
  • Manage project execution activities including contracting, construction, and budget and schedule management.
  • Provide on-site engineering and safety oversight during construction and commissioning phases of projects as required.
  • Assist with procurement and expediting activities.
  • Provide technical assistance to plants as required.
  • Examine processes and reconcile functional, operational and maintenance requirements with engineering parameters: daily.
  • Promote inherent safety in design and HSE priorities during site activities and field execution.
  • Non-routine and relatively unstructured tasks that require application of professional judgment, specialized methods, and advanced techniques.
  • Resolve engineering design conflicts that may occur throughout all stages of the project - daily.
  • Resolve problems with equipment specification, procurement and delivery that may arise throughout the project - daily.
  • Resolve schedule and budget problems involving supplier and subcontractors.
  • Tasks can involve integration of requirements from civil, mechanical and electrical engineering disciplines:
    • Mechanical scope includes drive systems, combustion systems, hydraulics, HVAC and piping.
    • Civil/structural scope including equipment foundations, pits, trenches and other interfaces between mechanical systems and civil or building structural systems.
  • Complexity of tasks will vary with project size and composition, but will range from installation of replacment or upgraded equipment to design and construction of new manufacturing plants or process lines.

Qualifications and Skills:


  • Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills.
  • Effective organizational skills including the ability to meet deadlines.
  • Attention to detail.
  • Ability to organize and manage the work of others, i.e. teams of Shawcor employees, contractors etc.
  • Ability to conceptualize solutions and effectively communicate them both verbally and in writing.
  • Excellent mechanical design ability and application of complex mechanical principles.
  • Strong computer literacy in AutoCAD, Inventor, Solidworks PDM, MS Project and MS Office with special emphasis on Word and Excel.
  • Bachlelor’s Degree – Mechanical Engineering
  • 6 - 10 Years - Experience working in the design engineering and construction management profession is preferred. Industry experience should include heavy manufacturing with operations and processes of the size and scale encountered at Shawcor (e.g., combustion systems, movement of heavy products, multi shift production environment, involving equipment including hydraulic and electrically powered motors/actuators, chemical and abrasive cleaning, acid/water wash, heating/cooling of finished products, handling of raw materials [powder, plastic]).

We thank all applicants for their interest; however we cannot accept telephone calls regarding this position. All recruiting activities are managed via our applicant tracking system. Please apply online to be considered for this opportunity.


Shawcor welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. To begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout our recruitment process, please contact our HR team at accessibility@shawcor.com.

title: Part Time Midnight Engineer
description:
Midnight Engineer

What is in it for you:

  • Employee benefit card offering discounted rates in Accor worldwide
  • Discount on Food & Beverage
  • Learning programs through our Academies and the opportunity to earn qualifications while you work
  • Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within your property and across the world
    Ability to make a difference in the local community through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21

    What you will be doing:
  • Take temperatures of all supply air units, concourse tenant spaces, meeting
  • Rooms, Restaurants, public areas and guest rooms. Identify problems and
  • Rectify.
  • Take pressure readings from all operational pumps. Identify any trouble and rectify.
  • Take temperature readings from all converters, make any necessary adjustments.
  • Walk-through 4-A mechanical, check status of Process boilers, air-compressors, verify that all fan units, pumps, converters and expansion tanks are operating correctly. Take readings from units not automated. Check operation of water softeners. Identify and repair deficiencies found.
  • Walk-through laundry to assure make-up air unit is running and temperature is controlled. Drain air-lines of moisture build-up. Take readings from Laundry hot water system. Visually inspect sprinkler manifold. Identify and repair deficiencies.
  • Take temperature readings of all Walk-in freezers and refrigerators, concourse mall, banquet rooms.
  • Walk through all areas of entire hotel including guest hallways. Visually inspect area for any deficiencies. Repair/report.
  • Check condition of fire panel, remove printout (if any)
  • Walk through Concourse mechanical, verify that all fan units, pumps converters etc. are operating correctly. Take readings from units not automated. Take meter readings for water and gas consumptions.
  • Check electrical vault. Take electrical meter readings.
  • Walk through 21st mechanical area. Verify that all fan units, pumps, converters, air compressors etc. are operating correctly. Take readings from units not automated. Take meter readings for boiler make-up, cooling tower make-up and cooling tower blowdown.
  • High Pressure boilers
  • 06:00 Start up, ensure proper operation of feed pumps, feed tank and controls.
  • 19:00 – 23:00, shut-down and log.
  • Chiller operation
  • 20:00 – log readings and general operation.
  • Pool testing/inspections – 06:00
  • Test swimming pool and whirlpool for correct chemical balance.
  • Add chemicals, adjust auto feeds as needed.
  • Inspect all safety equipment.
  • Inspect sauna for proper operation/safety
  • Guarded Status – daily
  • Test low water fuel cut-off on heating boilers.
  • Test flame failure cut-off on heating boilers.
  • Test low air pressure cut-off on heating boilers.
  • Test low gas pressure cut-off on heating boilers.
  • Test high pressure cut-off on heating boilers.
  • Weekly, test safety relieve valves and gage glass/tri-cocks.
  • Boiler Maintenance – spring x 4
  • Open up and clean fire and water sides.
  • Repair refractory, gaskets etc.
  • Ready for inspection.
  • Repair deficiencies
  • Close up and prepare for operation
  • Chiller/Cooling equipment – spring/fall
  • Fill/Drain cooling tower, clean each time
  • Isolate and drain all cooling coils in building. Flush with Glycol.
  • Flush to drain, then fill all cooling coils in building.
  • Isolate/drain irrigation system.
  • Isolate chilled and condenser pumps.
  • Guest Rooms-
  • Attend to all guest issues in 340 guest rooms in the hotel and maintain maintenance work related to the official maintenance of the property
  • Adhere to Preventive Maintenance Program in guest rooms and support the Chief Engineers and Engineering Supervisor to ensure that PM in guestrooms are completed twice a year.
  • Support Rooms Maintenance personnel in project works in guest rooms and public areas

  • Qualifications:
  • Must be holder of a Provincial 4th class power engineering ticket from the Department of Labour
  • Must have at least 2 years of experience in a 4th class power plant which includes a high pressure boiler.
  • Working knowledge of a Centrifugal chiller is an asset.

Your team and working environment:

Located in the heart of vibrant downtown Winnipeg, Manitoba - at the historic corner of Portage and Main - Fairmont Winnipeg luxury hotel extends the naturally warm reception of the Prairies. Just step outside our Winnipeg hotel and the city is at your feet.
Visa Requirements: To be eligible for employment with Fairmont Winnipeg, you must be in possession of a working visa for Canada. We do not provide offer letters to applicants seeking to get their work visas. Applicants must have their work visas in place prior to applying.

Our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?
We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.
By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS
